metadata.name: Suspicious FromBase64String Usage On Gzip Archive - Process Creation
metadata.comment: Detects attempts of decoding a base64 Gzip archive via PowerShell. This technique is often used as a method to load malicious content into memory afterward.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('frombase64string')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('memorystream')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('h4si')))

output.summary: Detects attempts of decoding a base64 Gzip archive via PowerShell. This technique is often used as a method to load malicious content into memory afterward.

metadata.objective: False positive: Legitimate administrative script Reference: https://speakerdeck.com/heirhabarov/hunting-for-powershell-abuse?slide=43
